title: "Your browser does not support high definition playback... experience" prompt on prime video
content:
I got the above mentioned prompt in prime video and the first thing I did was to rush here and check if anyone else had the same issue and a lot of people did, but the solutions that were provided underneath their tickets didn't seem to help me.

I tried everything, clearing cache and cookies, refreshing firefox, reinstalling firefox, but nothing helped, the same issue was occurring on the firefox app from MS store. I reached out to prime video's customer support but after few weeks of back and forth communication, they put their hands up as well. But they did inform me that "HD 1080p" which used to appear at the bottom left of a video has been removed due to unreliability.

It was one of my reference points to check if a video is actually running at higher definition along with the "Good, Better & Best" in the "Settings" option. But strangely enough it still shows 6.84 GBs per hour in the Best option which it does when a video is running at higher definition.

The prompt has thrown me in multiple directions, can anyone PLEASE HELP ME! I'm going crazy

title: On the issue that the firefox.exe process could not be concluded
content: 1.The browser is closed 2.Looking at the task manager, there are still two browser processes (firefox.exe) present and they together take up about 3GB of memory 3.These two processes have no I/O reads and writes. 4.These two processes cannot be concluded. I've tried CMD, Powshell, XueTr, etc., but none of them can free up the memory space occupied by these two processes.

title: Resizing windows of/in/on a webpage.  PiHole
content:
I'm not sure what's going on here, but speaking to different people, I hear different stories.

I use FireFox and have PiHole installed on a RasPi. REMOTE ACCESS.

There is a window - to call it - where I can enter any fixed IP addresses.

I can only open it a bit (height wise) but am being told it can open a lot more.

I've tried FireFox and Opera. Both don't allow it to open much more. (So really I don't think it is a Firefox problem)

Anyone have PiHole installed?

Settings/DHCP (expert level) Scroll down to Static DHCP configuration.

The window where you enter addresses.

How "big" can you make i
